comments.author: Werner
comments.body: A fairly intact deer skeleton just five feet or so off of the road was an interesting find. Dave found a car tire and some parts from a hot tub. We found lots of liquor bottles and cans. That's a bit scary... Beautiful day. Thanks Everyone. - Mark.

comments.author: Rob
comments.body: Alas, my sweet dog was in the hospital this morning, so at the LAST MINUTE I discovered I couldn't make it. She's been eating rocks again and fractured her tooth. Nothing a little oral surgery won't fix, but it kept me out of the festivities. Enjoy your recollections!

comments.author: Werner
comments.body: Oh yeah, I forgot one more thing; there was a golf ball on a fairly steep incline. It was a Wilson. If I remember correctly, I think Mike Matthies hits Wilsons. I bet he teed that one up on the roof of Telecom. I'd say it went ten miles at least on the first bounce. We'll have to call him "Extreme John Daly." -- Mark.

comments.author: Steve
comments.body: Rob, I hope Kylie's okay!! Wish her well from the Frenz!!!

comments.author: Greg
comments.body: I think finding the University of Illinois "diploma" -- actually just a certificate of appreciation from the Illini regents -- was a cool find. Coming across the scene of a car crash and all the debris was weird. But I have to agree that all the cigarette butts, although not a surprise, were very disappointing with all the wild fires we've had over the last few years. -Greg
